CatDescriptText: Richard M. Pastorius, real estate agent, Bethel Park and Rosalie Bentley, domestic, Rochester, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, October 7, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think Red China should be admitted to the United Nations?"  Mr .Pastorius' answer reads: "Definitely not.  I don't believe this government can recognize two Chinese governments.  Either we're with the Nationalist government or we're straddling the fence.  I feel the Red China government is definitely Communistic.  And our government has spoken out strongly in opposition to communism.  So why recognize a Communistic power?"  Mrs. Bentley's answer reads: "Frankly, I haven't given it too much thought."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Richard M. Pastorius wearing striped suit jacket and necktie, standing in front of stores, signs, and two men; Portrait of Rosalie Bentley wearing dark knitted cardigan and swirl patterned button down collared shirt, standing in front of C.A. Michel store window, Smithfield Street, Downtown
